page.title: 15The Branchage
page.content:
The{branchage}is the cutting of {hedges,}and{trees}which overhang public highways and pavements. The clearance over footpaths must be eight feet, and over roads twelve feet.
Every parish fixes a date for its branchage. The inspection in{July}is called the "Visite du Branchage". The one in{September}is called the "Visite des Chemins". Branchage is a very important Jersey custom. {The Roads {Committee,}i.e. Constable, Centeniers and Vingteniers of the parish tour the roads in a coach. If they find it has not been done properly the Vingtenier of that Vingtaine uses the measuring rod, and if the clearance is not enough he notes it and there is a fine of fifty pence for each infraction.
